Description.General: The s1kd-addicn tool adds the required DTD entity and notation declarations to an S1000D module in order to reference an ICN file.
Description.Usage: The usage of the tool is: s1kd-addicn [-o <file>] [-s <src>} [-fh?] <ICN>...

Option.name: -F
Option.description: Use the whole path given for the ICN file as the SYSTEM ID.

Option.name: -f
Option.description: Overwrite source file instead of writing to stdout.

Option.name: -o
Option.description: The filename to output to. Default is to write to stdout.

Option.name: --out
Option.description: The filename to output to. Default is to write to stdout.

Option.name: -s
Option.description: The source module to add the ICN(s) to. Default is to read from stdin.

Option.name: --source
Option.description: The source module to add the ICN(s) to. Default is to read from stdin.

Option.name: --huge
Option.description: Remove any internal arbitrary parser limits.

Option.name: --net
Option.description: Allow network access to load external DTD and entities.

Option.name: --xml-catalog
Option.description: Use an XML catalog when resolving entities. Multiple catalogs may be loaded by specifying this option multiple times.

Description.Example: An example usage of the tool is: $ s1kd-addicn -fs <DM> ICN-EX-12345-001-01.JPG
